query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Per correr miglior acque alza le vele 2 omai la navicella del mio ingegno, 3 che lascia dietro a sé mar sì crudele;
query.error: **English:** 1 To sail better waters, now hoist the sails 2 of the little ship of my intellect, 3 which leaves behind it such a cruel sea;
query.result: 1 Rag drehedha dowr gwell, hedhyw kodh an hwyliow 2 a'n avon byghan a'm spyrys, 3 hag a let wartha an mor krus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 e canterò di quel secondo regno 5 dove l’umano spirito si purga 6 e di salire al ciel diventa degno.
query.error: **English:** 4 and I will sing of that second realm 5 where the human spirit purifies itself 6 and becomes worthy to ascend to heaven.
query.result: 4 Ha kanon vy a-ganow a'n nessa rann 5 le mayth an spyrys denel a-burga 6 ha mos ha bos dhe skynna dhe'n nef.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Ma qui la morta poesì resurga, 8 o sante Muse, poi che vostro sono; 9 e qui Calïopè alquanto surga,
query.error: **English:** 7 But here may dead poetry rise again, 8 O holy Muses, since I am yours; 9 and here may Calliope rise somewhat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 seguitando il mio canto con quel suono 11 di cui le Piche misere sentiro 12 lo colpo tal, che disperar perdono.
query.error: **English:** 10 following my song with that sound 11 from which the wretched Magpies felt 12 such a blow that they despaired of forgiveness.
query.result: 10 ow sewya'm kan gans an son na gans an son 11 a-wrug an Pika trist an colp na, 12 bythkweth an pardon a-wrug an colp na.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Dolce color d’orïental zaffiro, 14 che s’accoglieva nel sereno aspetto 15 del mezzo, puro infino al primo giro,
query.error: **English:** 13 Sweet color of oriental sapphire, 14 which was gathered in the serene aspect 15 of the middle, pure up to the first circle,
query.result: 13 Liv gwyn a safir a'n est, 14 a-berthas yn an golwg seryn 15 a'n kres, pur dhe'n kynsa kelgh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 a li occhi miei ricominciò diletto, 17 tosto ch’io usci’ fuor de l’aura morta 18 che m’avea contristati li occhi e ’l petto.
query.error: **English:** 16 began to delight my eyes again, 17 as soon as I emerged from the dead air 18 that had distressed my eyes and chest.
query.result: 16 a-dallethas plesya'm hedhyw, 17 pan wovyn vy dhe'n awel marow 18 a-wrug ankenja'm lagha ha'm brust.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Lo bel pianeto che d’amar conforta 20 faceva tutto rider l’orïente, 21 velando i Pesci ch’erano in sua scorta.
query.error: **English:** 19 The beautiful planet that comforts with love 20 was making all the east smile, 21 veiling the Pisces that were in its escort.
query.result: 19 An planet gwyn a-wra dhe'n karanteth 20 a-wrug an est oll a-lowen, 21 ow kul an Pysk a-via yn y gila.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 I’ mi volsi a man destra, e puosi mente 23 a l’altro polo, e vidi quattro stelle 24 non viste mai fuor ch’a la prima gente.
query.error: **English:** 22 I turned to my right, and paid attention 23 to the other pole, and saw four stars 24 never seen except by the first people.
query.result: 22 Ythoma'm dhe'n dhrehevel, ha gorra'm 23 dhe'n pol arall, ha gweles vy peswar steren 24 heb gweles vy bythkweth gensi an kynsa pobel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Goder pareva ’l ciel di lor fiammelle: 26 oh settentrïonal vedovo sito, 27 poi che privato se’ di mirar quelle!
query.error: **English:** 25 Heaven seemed to rejoice in their flames: 26 O widowed northern region, 27 since you are deprived of gazing upon them!
query.result: 25 An nef a-lowen gans aga flammow: 26 O ranndir gwyls gweres, 27 wosa'th yw dibris a wul aga!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Com’ io da loro sguardo fui partito, 29 un poco me volgendo a l ’altro polo, 30 là onde ’l Carro già era sparito,
query.error: **English:** 28 When I had departed from their sight, 29 turning a little to the other pole, 30 from where the Wain had already disappeared,
query.result: 28 Pan wovyn vy a-dhrys aga golwg, 29 ow torna'm unn bythyn dhe'n pol arall, 30 le mayth an Karr a-via diwedhys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 vidi presso di me un veglio solo, 32 degno di tanta reverenza in vista, 33 che più non dee a padre alcun figliuolo.
query.error: **English:** 31 I saw near me an old man alone, 32 worthy of so much reverence in appearance, 33 that no son owes more to any father.
query.result: 31 Gweles vy ogasow unn den sol, 32 dyg dhe unn reverens krus yn y golwg, 33 moy ages dhe unn mab dhe unn tas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Lunga la barba e di pel bianco mista 35 portava, a’ suoi capelli simigliante, 36 de’ quai cadeva al petto doppia lista.
query.error: **English:** 34 His long beard, mixed with white hair, 35 he wore, similar to his hair, 36 of which a double tress fell on his chest.
query.result: 34 Hir o barv ha meskys gans blew gwynn 35 ev a-berthas, kepar y vlew, 36 a-dheuth dhe'n brust unn dhewbleth list.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Li raggi de le quattro luci sante 38 fregiavan sì la sua faccia di lume, 39 ch’i’ ’l vedea come ’l sol fosse davante.
query.error: **English:** 37 The rays of the four holy lights 38 so adorned his face with light, 39 that I saw him as if the sun were before me.
query.result: 37 An gwella a'n peswar golwg sanct 38 a-lowen y edhen gans golwg, 39 bythkweth yth welyn vy an howl o'm benn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 «Chi siete voi che contro al cieco fiume 41 fuggita avete la pregione etterna?», 42 diss’ el, movendo quelle oneste piume.
query.error: **English:** 40 "Who are you who against the blind river 41 have fled from eternal prison?", 42 he said, moving those honest feathers.
query.result: 40 "Piv ywghwi ow tos a-dhrys an avon dall 41 ow tos a-dhiwedh an carchar dorraghes?", 42 a leveris, ow tos a-waya an pluv onest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 «Chi v’ha guidati, o che vi fu lucerna, 44 uscendo fuor de la profonda notte 45 che sempre nera fa la valle inferna?
query.error: **English:** 43 "Who has guided you, or who was your lantern, 44 coming out of the deep night 45 that always makes the infernal valley black?
query.result: 43 "Piv a'th withas, po pyw an golow dhiso, 44 ow tos a-dhiwedh an nosow tewl 45 hag a wra an dowr ifern yn tywyll?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Son le leggi d’abisso così rotte? 47 o è mutato in ciel novo consiglio, 48 che, dannati, venite a le mie grotte?».
query.error: **English:** 46 Are the laws of the abyss so broken? 47 Or has a new counsel changed in heaven, 48 that you, damned souls, come to my caves?".
query.result: 46 Ha'th an lejyow a'n abys ow tos a-dhiwedh? 47 Po yw nowydh konsel ow tos a-gemmyans yn ayr, 48 wosagh, ow tos a-dhis dhe'm oghow?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Lo duca mio allor mi diè di piglio, 50 e con parole e con mani e con cenni 51 reverenti mi fé le gambe e ’l ciglio.
query.error: **English:** 49 My leader then took hold of me, 50 and with words and with hands and with gestures 51 respectful he made my legs and my brow bend.
query.result: 49 An dywghugh vy a roos pigo a'm, 50 ha gans ger ha gans dorn ha gans arwodhow 51 ow tos a-wra'm ow gar ha'm ow tal ow pos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Poscia rispuose lui: «Da me non venni: 53 donna scese del ciel, per li cui prieghi 54 de la mia compagnia costui sovvenni.
query.error: **English:** 52 Then he answered me: "I did not come of myself: 53 a lady descended from heaven, at whose prayers 54 I rescued this man from my company.
query.result: 52 Wosagh a leveris dhym: "Nyns yw ow tos a-dhis: 53 benen a dhiskynnas a'n ayr, rag an pyth pednow 54 ow tos a-dhiwedh an den-ma a'm kompani.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Ma da ch’è tuo voler che più si spieghi 56 di nostra condizion com’ ell’ è vera, 57 esser non puote il mio che a te si nieghi.
query.error: **English:** 55 But since it is your wish that our condition 56 be explained more fully, as it truly is, 57 it cannot be mine to refuse you.
query.result: 55 Mes rag yw dhis hwilas ow tos a-splegi moy 56 a-dro dhe'n kondisyon vy, kepar ha'n yw gwir, 57 nyns yw possybyl dhe'm ow tos a-dhiskwedhes dhiso.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Questi non vide mai l’ultima sera; 59 ma per la sua follia le fu sì presso, 60 che molto poco tempo a volger era.
query.error: **English:** 58 This man never saw the final evening; 59 but through his folly he came so close to it, 60 that very little time was left to turn back.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Sì com’ io dissi, fui mandato ad esso 62 per lui campare; e non lì era altra via 63 che questa per la quale i’ mi son messo.
query.error: **English:** 61 As I said, I was sent to him 62 to save him; and there was no other way 63 than this one on which I have set out.
query.result: 61 Kepar ha'm leveris, ow tos a-gas ve'dhyn 62 rag y dhe'n gwitha; ha nyns o an fordh aral 63 mes an fordh-ma ow tos ow tos a-gas ow pos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Mostrata ho lui tutta la gente ria; 65 e ora intendo mostrar quelli spirti 66 che purgan sé sotto la tua balìa.
query.error: **English:** 64 I have shown him all the wicked people; 65 and now I intend to show him those spirits 66 who are purging themselves under your authority.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Com’ io l’ho tratto, saria lungo a dirti; 68 de l’alto scende virtù che m’aiuta 69 conducerlo a vederti e a udirti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Or ti piaccia gradir la sua venuta: 71 libertà va cercando, ch’è sì cara, 72 come sa chi per lei vita rifiuta.
query.error: **English:** 70 Now may it please you to welcome his coming: 71 he goes seeking liberty, which is so dear, 72 as he knows who gives up his life for it.
query.result: 70 Lemmyn ow tos a-vynn ow tos a-vras y dhe'n dhis dos: 71 frydedh yw ow tos a-hwitha, hag yw kemmys ker, 72 kepar ha'n gwir an den ow tos a-gas y vewn rag y'dhyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Tu ’l sai, ché non ti fu per lei amara 74 in Utica la morte, ove lasciasti 75 la vesta ch’al gran dì sarà sì chiara.
query.error: **English:** 73 You know that death in Utica was not bitter for her, 74 where you left 75 the garment that on the great day will be so bright.
query.result: 73 Ty a wydh, na veu dhynni fetha amer 74 yn Utica ankow, le mayth ow thueth 75 an gwisk a vydh dhe'n dydh bras kemmys kler.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Non son li editti etterni per noi guasti, 77 ché questi vive e Minòs me non lega; 78 ma son del cerchio ove son li occhi casti

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 di Marzia tua, che ’n vista ancor ti priega, 80 o santo petto, che per tua la tegni: 81 per lo suo amore adunque a noi ti piega.
query.error: **English:** 79 of your Marcia, who in her gaze still prays to you, 80 O holy breast, that you hold her as yours: 81 for her love, then, bend to us.
query.result: 79 A'th Martia dha, yn hy golwg ow pyth dhymmyn, 80 O bronn sans, rag dhymmyn owth hy dalleth: 81 rag hy karanteth, plegya dhymmyn dhyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Lasciane andar per li tuoi sette regni; 83 grazie riporterò di te a lei, 84 se d’esser mentovato là giù degni».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 «Marzïa piacque tanto a li occhi miei 86 mentre ch’i’ fu’ di là», diss’ elli allora, 87 «che quante grazie volse da me, fei.
query.error: **English:** 85 "Marcia was so pleasing to my eyes 86 while I was there," he said then, 87 "that whatever favors she asked of me, I did.
query.result: 85 "Marzïa a veu kemmys gwynnik dhe'm golwgow 86 pan veu'm ow bys ena," leveris ena, 87 "na pyth grasow a vynnas dhymmyn, ow fetha."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Or che di là dal mal fiume dimora, 89 più muover non mi può, per quella legge 90 che fatta fu quando me n’usci’ fora.
query.error: **English:** 88 Now that she dwells beyond the evil river, 89 she can move me no more, because of that law 90 that was made when I went forth from there.
query.result: 88 Mes lemmyn ow triga hi drefen an avon kas, 89 nyns yw possybyl dhymmyn mos mova moy, rag an lagha 90 a veu gwres pan veu'm ow tos owth ena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ma se donna del ciel ti move e regge, 92 come tu di’, non c’è mestier lusinghe: 93 bastisi ben che per lei mi richegge.
query.error: **English:** 91 But if a lady from heaven moves and guides you, 92 as you say, there is no need for flattery: 93 it is enough for you to ask me for her sake.
query.result: 91 Mes mar benyn a'n nef a wra'th mova ha rewlya, 92 dell yw leveris, nyns eus mester luskyow: 93 dell yw dhodho dhe'm pyth rag hy.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

97 ché non si converria, l’occhio sorpriso 98 d’alcuna nebbia, andar dinanzi al primo 99 ministro, ch’è di quei di paradiso.

query.result: 97 Rag nyns eus dell, an golwg ow pos sesyes 98 gans neppyth, mos mos dhe'n kynsa 99 mynistr, ow sy a'n re a baradys.

query.prompt:

100 Questa isoletta intorno ad imo ad imo, 101 là giù colà dove la batte l’onda, 102 porta di giunchi sovra ’l molle limo:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 null’ altra pianta che facesse fronda 104 o indurasse, vi puote aver vita, 105 però ch’a le percosse non seconda.
query.error: **English:** 103 no other plant that would make leaves 104 or grow hard could have life there, 105 because it does not withstand the beatings.
query.result: 103 Nyns eus plantow erel a wra'th gwre frondow 104 po kulha, a alla bos possybyl byw ena, 105 rag nyns yw moy dhe'n skepyow ow pos sesya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Poscia non sia di qua vostra reddita; 107 lo sol vi mosterrà, che surge omai, 108 prendere il monte a più lieve salita».
query.error: **English:** 106 Afterwards, let your return not be this way; 107 the sun, which is rising now, will show you 108 how to take the mountain by an easier ascent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Così sparì; e io sù mi levai 110 sanza parlare, e tutto mi ritrassi 111 al duca mio, e li occhi a lui drizzai.
query.error: **English:** 109 Thus he disappeared; and I rose up 110 without speaking, and drew myself back 111 to my guide, and fixed my eyes on him.
query.result: 109 Dell yw henwys; ha ow sevel omma 110 heb leverel, ha owth omma dhe-ugh 111 dhe'm dug, ha owth omma'm golwgow dhe'dho.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 El cominciò: «Figliuol, segui i miei passi: 113 volgianci in dietro, ché di qua dichina 114 questa pianura a’ suoi termini bassi».
query.error: **English:** 112 He began: "Son, follow my steps: 113 let us turn back, for from here slopes down 114 this plain to its lowest depths."
query.result: 112 Ev a dhallethas: "Mab, sewgh vy fosow: 113 treylym orth, ragma an-ma'th onan 114 an plan-ma dhe'ythoselma isel."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 L’alba vinceva l’ora mattutina 116 che fuggia innanzi, sì che di lontano 117 conobbi il tremolar de la marina.
query.error: **English:** 115 Dawn was conquering the morning hour 116 that fled before it, so that from afar 117 I recognized the shimmering of the sea.
query.result: 115 An gwawr a veu an eur myttyn 116 ow tos orth, marow byttegen, 117 ha'm aswon an mor ow tewhelek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Noi andavam per lo solingo piano 119 com’ om che torna a la perduta strada, 120 che ’nfino ad essa li pare ire in vano.
query.error: **English:** 118 We went on our way across the solitary plain 119 like one who returns to the lost road, 120 who until he reaches it seems to be going in vain.
query.result: 118 Ni a veu orth war an plan sojyl 119 kepar den ow tos dhe'n fordh kollet, 120 hag bys dhe'ythosel a wra'n efan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Quando noi fummo là ’ve la rugiada 122 pugna col sole, per essere in parte 123 dove, ad orezza, poco si dirada,
query.error: **English:** 121 When we were there where the dew 122 contends with the sun, because it is in a place 123 where, in the breeze, it evaporates little,
query.result: 121 Pan veu ni le may le mayth a wra 122 ow pos orth hag an howl, rag orth y'n le 123 le mayth, orth an awel, byttegen,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 ambo le mani in su l’erbetta sparte 125 soavemente ’l mio maestro pose: 126 ond’ io, che fui accorto di sua arte,
query.error: **English:** 124 both his hands he spread out on the grass 125 and gently placed me there: 126 whereupon I, who understood his plan,
query.result: 124 y'n dew dorn orth an geyn, 125 ow'm a ros orth yn davas, 126 ha'm, ow komprehendyas y'n arta,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 porsi ver’ lui le guance lagrimose; 128 ivi mi fece tutto discoverto 129 quel color che l’inferno mi nascose.
query.error: **English:** 127 turned my tearful cheeks towards him; 128 there he made me fully reveal 129 the color that Hell had hidden from me.
query.result: 127 a ros vy dhelergh orth, 128 le mayth ow'm a wrug orth pub 129 an liv ow tos an Ifarn orth vy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Venimmo poi in sul lito diserto, 131 che mai non vide navicar sue acque 132 omo, che di tornar sia poscia esperto.
query.error: **English:** 130 Then we came to the deserted shore, 131 whose waters no man has ever sailed 132 who later had experience of returning.
query.result: 130 Ni a veu wosa dhe'n fordh difeyth, 131 le may nyns gwelas den vyth navigat 132 y'n dowrow, ow tos experyens orth wosa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Quivi mi cinse sì com’ altrui piacque: 134 oh maraviglia! ché qual elli scelse 135 l’umile pianta, cotal si rinacque
query.error: **English:** 133 There he encircled me as it pleased another: 134 oh marvel! for as he chose 135 the humble plant, so it sprang up again
query.result: 133 Gen le mayth ow'm a wrug orth kepar den aral, 134 oh marrek! rag kepar hag ev a dhewis 135 an plans isel, marow ev a'gas orth

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 subitamente là onde l’avelse.
query.error: **English:** 136 suddenly in the place from which he had pulled it.
query.result: 136 orth an le mayth gen le mayth ev a'gas orth.
